## PHASE 1: Discover ALL Gherkin files
```bash
echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
```

## PHASE 2: Parse ALL features and build complete TODO list
```bash
echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "  PHASE 2: PARSING ALL FEATURES"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

# Create temporary file for TODO list
TODO_FILE="/tmp/jira_todo_$$.txt"
> "$TODO_FILE"  # Clear file

STORY_COUNT=0
RULE_COUNT=0
SCENARIO_COUNT=0

# Parse each feature file COMPLETELY before moving to next
for FEATURE_FILE in $FEATURE_FILES; do
  echo "\nğŸ“„ Parsing: $FEATURE_FILE"
  
  # Extract Feature name
  FEATURE_NAME=$(grep -m 1 "^Feature:" "$FEATURE_FILE" | sed 's/Feature: *//')
  
  if [ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]; then
    echo "  âš ï¸ No Feature declaration found - SKIPPING"
    continue
  fi
  
  STORY_COUNT=$((STORY_COUNT + 1))
  echo "  âœ“ Feature: $FEATURE_NAME"
  
  # Add to TODO list
  echo "STORY|$FEATURE_FILE|$FEATURE_NAME" >> "$TODO_FILE"
  
  # Extract ALL Rules for this feature
  RULES=$(grep "^  Rule:" "$FEATURE_FILE" | sed 's/  Rule: *//')
  
  if [ -n "$RULES" ]; then
    while IFS= read -r RULE; do
      RULE_COUNT=$((RULE_COUNT + 1))
      echo "    âœ“ Rule: $RULE"
      echo "RULE|$FEATURE_FILE|$FEATURE_NAME|$RULE" >> "$TODO_FILE"
    done <<< "$RULES"
  fi
  
  # Extract ALL Scenarios with their associated rules
  # Use awk to maintain context of which rule each scenario belongs to
  awk '
    BEGIN { feature_file = "'"$FEATURE_FILE"'"; feature_name = "'"$FEATURE_NAME"'" }
    /^  Rule:/ { current_rule = substr($0, 9); }
    /^    Scenario:/ || /^    Scenario Outline:/ {
      scenario_name = substr($0, index($0, ":") + 2);
      print "SCENARIO|" feature_file "|" feature_name "|" current_rule "|" scenario_name;
    }
    /^  Scenario:/ {
      # Handle scenarios without rules
      scenario_name = substr($0, index($0, ":") + 2);
      print "SCENARIO|" feature_file "|" feature_name "||" scenario_name;
    }
  ' "$FEATURE_FILE" >> "$TODO_FILE"
  
  # Count scenarios for this feature
  FEATURE_SCENARIOS=$(grep "SCENARIO|$FEATURE_FILE" "$TODO_FILE" | wc -l)
  SCENARIO_COUNT=$((SCENARIO_COUNT + FEATURE_SCENARIOS))
  echo "    âœ“ Scenarios: $FEATURE_SCENARIOS"
done

echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "  TODO LIST SUMMARY"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "ğŸ“Š Total Stories to create: $STORY_COUNT"
echo "ğŸ“Š Total Rules (acceptance criteria): $RULE_COUNT"
echo "ğŸ“Š Total Scenarios (subtasks): $SCENARIO_COUNT"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
```

## PHASE 4: Process TODO list and create JIRA items IN ORDER
```bash
echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "  PHASE 4: CREATING JIRA ITEMS"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

# Process TODO list line by line IN EXACT ORDER
CURRENT_STORY_ID=""
CURRENT_STORY_NAME=""
STORIES_CREATED=0
SUBTASKS_CREATED=0

# Read TODO list and process each item
while IFS='|' read -r TYPE FILE NAME RULE SCENARIO; do
  case "$TYPE" in
    "STORY")
      echo "\nğŸ“Œ Creating Story: $NAME"
      
      # Create the story in JIRA
      STORY_RESPONSE=$(acli jira issue create \
        --project "$REPO_NAME" \
        --type "Story" \
        --summary "$NAME" \
        --description "Feature implementation from $FILE" \
        --output json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
      
      CURRENT_STORY_ID=$(echo "$STORY_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.key' 2>/dev/null || echo "")
      
      if [ -n "$CURRENT_STORY_ID" ] && [ "$CURRENT_STORY_ID" != "null" ]; then
        echo "  âœ… Created Story: $CURRENT_STORY_ID"
        STORIES_CREATED=$((STORIES_CREATED + 1))
        CURRENT_STORY_NAME="$NAME"
        
        # Track this story ID for later use
        echo "$CURRENT_STORY_ID|$NAME" >> "/tmp/stories_created_$$.txt"
      else
        echo "  âŒ Failed to create story - STOPPING"
        echo "  Response: $STORY_RESPONSE"
        exit 1
      fi
      ;;
      
    "RULE")
      # Rules are collected and added to story description after all are found
      echo "  ğŸ“ Rule noted: $RULE"
      # Store rules for batch update
      echo "$CURRENT_STORY_ID|$RULE" >> "/tmp/rules_$$.txt"
      ;;
      
    "SCENARIO")
      if [ -z "$CURRENT_STORY_ID" ]; then
        echo "  âš ï¸ No story ID for scenario - SKIPPING"
        continue
      fi
      
      echo "  ğŸ“‹ Creating Subtask: $SCENARIO"
      
      # Build subtask description
      if [ -n "$RULE" ]; then
        SUBTASK_DESC="Rule: $RULE\n\nScenario implementation"
      else
        SUBTASK_DESC="Scenario implementation"
      fi
      
      # Create the subtask
      SUBTASK_RESPONSE=$(acli jira issue create \
        --project "$REPO_NAME" \
        --type "Sub-task" \
        --parent "$CURRENT_STORY_ID" \
        --summary "$SCENARIO" \
        --description "$SUBTASK_DESC" \
        --output json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
      
      SUBTASK_ID=$(echo "$SUBTASK_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.key' 2>/dev/null || echo "")
      
      if [ -n "$SUBTASK_ID" ] && [ "$SUBTASK_ID" != "null" ]; then
        echo "    âœ… Created Subtask: $SUBTASK_ID"
        SUBTASKS_CREATED=$((SUBTASKS_CREATED + 1))
      else
        echo "    âŒ Failed to create subtask"
        echo "    Response: $SUBTASK_RESPONSE"
      fi
      ;;
  esac
done < "$TODO_FILE"

echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "  PHASE 4 COMPLETE"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "âœ… Stories created: $STORIES_CREATED"
echo "âœ… Subtasks created: $SUBTASKS_CREATED"
```

## PHASE 5: Update stories with collected acceptance criteria
```bash
echo "\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo "  PHASE 5: UPDATING ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA"
echo "â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"

# Process rules file and update stories
if [ -f "/tmp/rules_$$.txt" ]; then
  # Group rules by story
  CURRENT_STORY=""
  RULES_TEXT=""
  
  while IFS='|' read -r STORY_ID RULE; do
    if [ "$STORY_ID" != "$CURRENT_STORY" ]; then
      # Update previous story if exists
      if [ -n "$CURRENT_STORY" ] && [ -n "$RULES_TEXT" ]; then
        echo "  ğŸ“ Updating $CURRENT_STORY with acceptance criteria"
        
        acli jira issue update "$CURRENT_STORY" \
          --description "Acceptance Criteria:\n$RULES_TEXT\n\nAutomatically generated from Gherkin" 2>/dev/null
        
        echo "    âœ… Updated"
      fi
      
      # Start new story
      CURRENT_STORY="$STORY_ID"
      RULES_TEXT="- $RULE"
    else
      # Add to current rules
      RULES_TEXT="$RULES_TEXT\n- $RULE"
    fi
  done < "/tmp/rules_$$.txt"
  
  # Update last story
  if [ -n "$CURRENT_STORY" ] && [ -n "$RULES_TEXT" ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“ Updating $CURRENT_STORY with acceptance criteria"
    
    acli jira issue update "$CURRENT_STORY" \
      --description "Acceptance Criteria:\n$RULES_TEXT\n\nAutomatically generated from Gherkin" 2>/dev/null
    
    echo "    âœ… Updated"
  fi
fi
```

2. **PARSE** - Parse ALL features completely, building TODO list

   - Move to next Story
5. **UPDATE** - Batch update stories with acceptance criteria
6. **RECORD** - Track what was processed
